body:
I am on stage crew for the upcoming production of Grease at my school.  For the next 6.5 hours, I am trapped in a stuffy auditorium and I am not allowed (for the most part) to talk.  My boyfriend refuses to respond to texts so I am utterly alone.  Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to respond to this post and just tell me about yourself.  I am not in game much so this is pretty much my method of learning who the prominent members of the community are.  You can also ask me anything.  I will literally answer any question, even if you don't really want the answer, so be careful.  And have fun!

UPDATE 17:20:09 EDT: My boyfriend is currently responding to texts again.

replies.body:
I am Tanpiku. Former moderator and head mapdev of the server and a current official/livestreamer/mapdev, I partake in a lot of stuff behind the door that isn't usually too much known. I've been on Avicus for over a year now and a year by now being a staff member. With ups and downs, I've made many friends along the way and have done work with the others in shaping up the server. Being a member of the map committee back in the old server, that is when I made my first debut eventually becoming the first map developer (being the user rank, heh).

My first map here was Serenitox and I found out this server first by Avalanche Network, then secondarily to make me return some people accusing Avicus of ripping off OCN. Checking it out, I actually got hooked in with it really quick. The moment I cherish most is being interviewed the first time and having the doors open to me for all the opportunity and friends I could make, and the moment I cherished the least is when I abused a glitch, ending up in a half-retirement half-demotion. 

 I don't like going too in-depth of my IRL, because it's boring and is more trouble than it's worth, but if you want my Avicus history then yeah. First joined in MCZone, and got teamspleefed on Senex II the first time I joined :()

Winter, but i like summer very much though
For me, i like frozen dead trees, frozen ground with meters of untouched snow.
It's also very calm during winter, no bugs, and for me it has the best landscapes.
Also i like the cold.

For summer, i love not having to suit up on heavy clothing, and i just feel more cheered up
Also, summer holidays.
The bugs and the extreme heat is pretty annoying tho, it sometimes takes me 4 hours just to fall asleep from the heat.

replies.body:
Actually i have a correction to make here i talk to you and i still think your a bit of a c*nt. 
Joking i love you Yobin


I'm BmB. (my initials) 
My name is Barney Michael Bannister (internet get stalking)
I live in England:York 
Before anyone says i shouldn't be dishing this out online i would honestly enjoy to watch someone try and track me down. 


I don't reveal my age because it's funny trying to watch people guess it and a sort of joke in my friend group.

I'm not appreciated. 

I'm an old timer here but in terms of being connected with the community i have quite a large gap to fill as i was banned in game and on the website for five months leading to a large hole of Avicus things. For instance i didn't even know Avicus had a second dev and never mind that an interesting dev that actually interects with the community and doesn't seem to be money orientated. I never left minecraft in that ban time however and i am even thankfull for it now as it has made me a better player as i spent the majority of the time on OCN, kohi and badlion but if you are checking my stats this isn't my main account, i just use it for Avicus as it was the account i first found MCzone on and got into the community with.

I stick around online because i don't have a fantastic irl friend group. I have lots of friends however none who i really feel loyal and comfortable with and i am that one who is always sacrificed or undermined. I had a pretty awful start to secondary/high school (an age clue for those who are sad enough to care) as i was placed on the opposite side of the year to all my primary/elementary school having no lessons with them. This made me a bit detatched and forced me to spread my wings which has both been fantastic and a pain. Somehow the friends that i latched onto are all in a tight group from the same primary school, with parents who are just as good a friends and that are much richer than me and make me jelly as f*ck.  I come from a pretty shitty area of a nice city, a shitty school surrounded by richer ones, live in a shitty house with shitty parents and most of all a shitty computer.  
I love sport as i find it's a way of channeling bad energy into a good thing my main sports being Basketball (in england i know) and athletics. 

Despite all this i am actually a stupidly lively and slightly crazy person. My online personna mirrors my irl one however with all the qualities i don't feel acceptable irl and with my girlfriend i let out to the full online. 

I am unfortunately primarily famous for being a d!ck.This is because i am not afraid to speak my mind and have an unfortunately large vocabulary and a strange thought proccess. I am good at manipulating people and understanding their thoughts which is both useful and not. 

 I have dreams of working in the media or politics with some of my unusual idols being Matt Stone and Trey Parker who are adult versions of me. Turned there thoughts into a projection that is often considered unruly and abusive yet they gain thousands of fans and lots of money in the doing so.


By the way i would like to mention i don't normally poor my heart out into depressing paragraphs and pry for attention over the internet i just felt like it today for some reason as well as this other people seem to have taken this thread as an opportunity to do this and you seem like an interesting guy. 

If you read this you are either an incredibly boring person with no life or someone interested in me in which case i applaud you for the good choice ;)

I'm BmB. (my initials) 
My name is Barney Michael Bannister (internet get stalking)
I live in England:York 
Before anyone says i shouldn't be dishing this out online i would honestly enjoy to watch someone try and track me down. 


I don't reveal my age because it's funny trying to watch people guess it and a sort of joke in my friend group.

I'm not appreciated. 

I'm an old timer here but in terms of being connected with the community i have quite a large gap to fill as i was banned in game and on the website for five months leading to a large hole of Avicus things. For instance i didn't even know Avicus had a second dev and never mind that an interesting dev that actually interects with the community and doesn't seem to be money orientated. I never left minecraft in that ban time however and i am even thankfull for it now as it has made me a better player as i spent the majority of the time on OCN, kohi and badlion but if you are checking my stats this isn't my main account, i just use it for Avicus as it was the account i first found MCzone on and got into the community with.

I stick around online because i don't have a fantastic irl friend group. I have lots of friends however none who i really feel loyal and comfortable with and i am that one who is always sacrificed or undermined. I had a pretty awful start to secondary/high school (an age clue for those who are sad enough to care) as i was placed on the opposite side of the year to all my primary/elementary school having no lessons with them. This made me a bit detatched and forced me to spread my wings which has both been fantastic and a pain. Somehow the friends that i latched onto are all in a tight group from the same primary school, with parents who are just as good a friends and that are much richer than me and make me jelly as f*ck.  I come from a pretty shitty area of a nice city, a shitty school surrounded by richer ones, live in a shitty house with shitty parents and most of all a shitty computer.  
I love sport as i find it's a way of channeling bad energy into a good thing my main sports being Basketball (in england i know) and athletics. 

Despite all this i am actually a stupidly lively and slightly crazy person. My online personna mirrors my irl one however with all the qualities i don't feel acceptable irl and with my girlfriend i let out to the full online. 

I am unfortunately primarily famous for being a d!ck.This is because i am not afraid to speak my mind and have an unfortunately large vocabulary and a strange thought proccess. I am good at manipulating people and understanding their thoughts which is both useful and not. 

 I have dreams of working in the media or politics with some of my unusual idols being Matt Stone and Trey Parker who are adult versions of me. Turned there thoughts into a projection that is often considered unruly and abusive yet they gain thousands of fans and lots of money in the doing so.


By the way i would like to mention i don't normally poor my heart out into depressing paragraphs and pry for attention over the internet i just felt like it today for some reason as well as this other people seem to have taken this thread as an opportunity to do this and you seem like an interesting guy. 

If you read this you are either an incredibly boring person with no life or someone interested in me in which case i applaud you for the good choice ;)

replies.body:
I'm betting there are many questions we COULD ask, but keeping it PG would be a bit hard IMO. Teenagers and our stupid hormones. >.<

When and how (like how did it happen) did you "come out"?
How did your family feel?
How did your friends feel?
Was it a surpise, or were people generally like "Yeah, I can see it."?
replies.body_tagged:
I'm betting there are many questions we COULD ask, but keeping it PG would be a bit hard IMO. Teenagers and our stupid hormones. >.<

When and how (like how did it happen) did you "come out"?
How did your family feel?
How did your friends feel?
Was it a surpise, or were people generally like "Yeah, I can see it."?

replies.body:
I came out to my friend at a party during fall of my freshman year.  It was after a football game and one of the juniors in band was throwing a little get-together afterward.  I just took him outside and told him about how I felt differently about guys than all of my other friends did.  He seriously didn't care at all.  After that, I slowly and painfully came out to other members of my family but it was hard at first because I thought I was bisexual and I thought that would be easier for people to understand, but it wasn't in the long run.  I finally admitted to myself and to others that I was gay, not bisexual, around Christmas.  None of my friends cared.  Literally none of them.  Nor did my family, after my parents adjusted.  I had literally been raised being told that "It's okay to be gay," but it's still so difficult to come to terms with a reality that doesn't fit the one you've been living for 15 years.  My parents were just worried since I chose to come out so fast and to everyone at once, but I knew that's what I had to do. 

And yeah, nobody saw it coming.  I had had a few girlfriends and anything.  People still tell me what a shock it is to them.

replies.body:
Hey, pavilion and Enflaming! Hope you guys don't mind, but I wanted to give some insight based on my personal experience.

I'm bisexual, or I'm attracted to both males and females. There's some things I like about females, and some things I like about males.  I don't know why I am, I just... am. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I first discovered that I was "different" in sixth grade. At the time, I didn't even know that liking dudes was a thing; like, no idea it even existed. When I found out, I was like "...Yeah, this might be me". To me, body parts don't matter, it's the person itself that matters.

My family... hmm. I think they knew something was different about me, but they couldn't prove it because I've never dated anyone. Only my mom knows, and even though she's fine with it, I still get the feeling that she wants me to be with a girl. It's kinda hard, but it's not like I chose this, you know?

My friends, it's a different story. See, I go to a charter school, one that focuses on the arts, so you're going to see a lot of "out" people. My friends are perfectly fine with it. It's almost like it doesn't matter, and it shouldn't. Those are the people that you should be around and I'm glad they're in my life.

It wasn't as much as a surprise, but I was definitely scared. There's a part of me that never wants to date or marry someone because I feel like it's going to make things very complicated. I even tried to make myself asexual, but that didn't work out. Right now, I'm just going to focus on school. But if someone makes me feel something different inside, I'm definitely going to see where it goes.

My family... hmm. I think they knew something was different about me, but they couldn't prove it because I've never dated anyone. Only my mom knows, and even though she's fine with it, I still get the feeling that she wants me to be with a girl. It's kinda hard, but it's not like I chose this, you know?

My friends, it's a different story. See, I go to a charter school, one that focuses on the arts, so you're going to see a lot of "out" people. My friends are perfectly fine with it. It's almost like it doesn't matter, and it shouldn't. Those are the people that you should be around and I'm glad they're in my life.

It wasn't as much as a surprise, but I was definitely scared. There's a part of me that never wants to date or marry someone because I feel like it's going to make things very complicated. I even tried to make myself asexual, but that didn't work out. Right now, I'm just going to focus on school. But if someone makes me feel something different inside, I'm definitely going to see where it goes.

It's really good to go to an artistic school.  My friend Christian goes there and he keeps trying to convince me to switch schools so I can experience non-hetero people (I'm really the only one out at my school).

replies.body:
It's so awesome to see people that are out and proud :D
And something that people seem to often forget is that, while there's nothing you can do to change your sexuality, it is fluid.  It can change just as your interests in other things change.

Nasty slurs are the worst.  I really don't care, words mean nothing to me, but I still am on a crusade to eliminate such slurs from the Internet because I know that for some (maybe even most) people, those words are hurtful, whether the speaker knows it or not.

replies.body:
For programming, my favorite was probably 1.2.5.  I literally have no clue why.  I just remember that MCP (Minecraft Coder Pack, for those who don't know, is a program that makes the Minecraft code readable) worked really well for that version and I didn't have issues.  If it wasn't 1.2.5 it was 1.2.something.  For playing, I like the game as simple as I can get it (within reason) so I miss beta 1.8.1.  That's where I started playing.  I'm a bit late compared to most other people I talk to but I really liked that version and sometimes I still play it for nostalgia purposes.

I used to do client side modding but I really have fallen away from that for one reason or another.  I just don't really use it.  I feel like server-side coding is much more rewarding.  I can't really explain this so well, but in my mind it's cleaner and feels more like it's something that is supposed to happen.  Just one of those things that doesn't really fit within the constrains of human language.

Thank you, I'm sure lucky too :3
